# Homework
## Section 1
- Class 1 - Binary Search
    - 1.1. Classical Binary Search
    - 1.2. Binary Search In Sorted 2D Array I
    - 1.3. Closest Number In Sorter Array
    - 1.4. First Occurrence
    - 1.5. Last Occurrence
    - 1.6. K Closest In Sorted Array
    - 1.7. Search In Unknown Sized Sorted Array
- Class 2 - Recursion I and Sorting Algorithms
    - 2.1 Fibonacci Number
    - 2.2 a To The Power Of b
    - 2.3 Selection Sort
    - 2.4 Merge Sort
    - 2.5 Quick Sort
    - 2.6 Move 0s To The End I
    - 2.7 Rainbow Sort
- Class 3 - Linked Lists
    - 3.1 Reverse Linked List
    - 3.2 Find Middle Node Of Linked List
    - 3.3 Check If Linked List Has Cycle
    - 3.4 Insert In Sorted Linked List
    - 3.5 Merge Two Sorted Linked List
    - 3.6 Reorder Linked List
    - 3.7 Partition Linked List
- Class 4 - Queue and Stack
    - 4.1 Sort Numbers In Two Stacks
    - 4.2 Implement Queue By Two Stacks
    - 4.3 Stack With min()
- Class 5 - Binary Tree & Binary Search Tree
    - 5.1 Binary Tree Pre-order Iterative Traversal
    - 5.2 Binary Tree In-order Iterative Traversal
    - 5.3 Binary Tree Post-order Iterative Traversal
    - 5.4 Check If Binary Tree Is Balanced
    - 5.5 Check If Binary Tree Is Symmetric
    - 5.6 Tweaked Identical Binary Trees
    - 5.7 Is Binary Search Tree Or Not
    - 5.8 Get Keys In Binary Search Tree In Given Range
- Class 6 - Heap & Graph Search Algorithm I (BFS)
    - 6.1 K Smallest In Unsorted Array
    - 6.2 Get Keys In Binary Tree Layer By Layer
    - 6.3 Bipartite
    - 6.4 Check If Binary Tree Is Complete
    - 6.5 Kth Smallest Number In Sorted Matrix
- Class 7 - Graph Search Algorithm II (DFS)
    - 7.1 All Subsets I
    - 7.2 All Valid Permutations Of Parentheses I
    - 7.3 Combinations Of Coins
    - 7.4 All Permutations I
- Class 8 - HashTable & String I
    - 8.1 Top K Frequent Words
    - 8.2 Missing Number I
    - 8.3 Common Numbers Of Two Sorted Arrays
    - 8.4 Remove Certain Characters
    - 8.5 Remove All Leading/Trailing/Duplicate Space Characters
    - 8.6 Remove Adjacent Repeated Characters I
    - 8.7 Remove Adjacent Repeated Characters IV
    - 8.8 Determine If One String Is Another’s Substring
- Class 9 - String II
    - 9.1 Reverse String
    - 9.2 Reverse Words In Sentence
    - 9.3 Right Shift By N Characters
    - 9.4 String Replace
    - 9.5 String Shuffling
    - 9.6 All Permutations II (with duplicate characters)
    - 9.7 Compress String II
    - 9.8 Decompress String II
    - 9.9 Longest Substring With Only Unique Characters
    - 9.10 Find All Anagrams Of Short String In A Long String
- Class 10 - Bit Representation and Bit Operation
    - 10.1 Determine If A Number Is Power Of 2
    - 10.2 Number Of Different Bits
    - 10.3 All Unique Characters II
    - 10.4 Reverse Bits
    - 10.5 Hexadecimal Representation
- Class 11 - DFS II
    - 11.1 All Subsequences Of Sorted String (All Subsets II)
    - 11.2 All Valid Permutations Of Parentheses II (L pairs of (), M pairs of [], N pairs of {})
    - 11.3 N Queens
    - 11.4 Generate Random Maze
- Class 12 - Dynamic Programming I
    - 12.1 Longest Ascending Subarray
    - 12.2 Max Product Of Cutting Rope
    - 12.3 Array Hopper I
- Class 13 - Dynamic Programming II
    - 13.1 Array Hopper II
    - 13.2 Largest Subarray Sum
    - 13.3 Dictionary Word
    - 13.4 Edit Distance
    - 13.5 Largest Square Of 1s
- Class 14 - Dynamic Programming III
    - 14.1 Longest Consecutive 1s
    - 14.2 Largest Cross With All 1s
    - 14.3 Largest X With All 1s
    - 14.4 Largest Subsquare Surrounded By 1s
    - 14.5 Largest Submatrix Sum
- Class 15 - Probability, Sampling, Randomization
    - 15.1 Shuffle
    - 15.2 Reservoir Sampling
    - 15.3 Reservoir Sampling With K Samples
    - 15.4 Random7 Using Random5
    - 15.5 Random1000 Using Random5
    - 15.6 Median Tracker Of Data Flow
    - 15.7 95th Percentile
- Class 16 - Recursion II
